Dallas C# SIG May meeting: Distributing asynchronous background tasks with Topshelf and NServiceBus

May 5, 2012

Register for the meeting here.

Abstract
In this session Leblanc will show you the ins and outs on Topshelf and NServiceBus and how to leverage these tools to help you scale. Topshelf makes window services easy to build and test. NServiceBus helps you queue, distribute, and process asynchronous background tasks. Get a glimpse at the black magic Leblanc uses on a day to day basis.

Bio
Leblanc is an micropreneur and technical lead capable of building teams and bringing multi-tenant SaaS products to market. Leblanc has years of industry experience in all aspects of the application life cycle management. He has gathered and managed requirements, and demonstrated his object-oriented architecture design with many UML and ER diagrams. Leblanc has also established his implementation abilities with various languages and platforms, generally using a test-driven development approach, and always using continuous integration process to improve quality and reduce time to market.Leblanc has a Bachelor of Science degree in Electronic Engineering Technology from Texas A&M University.Leblanc is Co-Founder of improvingrestaurants.com and Founder of robusthaven.com.

About us

The Dallas C# SIG meets monthly on the 1st Thursday from 6:30pm to 8:30pm at the Improving Enterprises offices in Addison, TX. Subscribe to receive email notifications about monthly meetings.
